explanation: The report is correct. In metal_irq_allocate the local variable cntr is only used to read fields (cntr->irq_base and cntr->irq_num) and is never used to modify the pointed-to object. Per MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible, so declaring cntr as const struct metal_irq_controller *cntr would be appropriate. The container_of expression yields a non-const pointer, but converting from T * to const T * is allowed without a cast, so making cntr const is feasible and would satisfy the rule. (No other uses in this function require cntr to be non-const.)
